intro: Echiochilon jugatum, commonly known as the yellow bell heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
